body_html:
@gunan I believe one does need to patch Bazel on TX1 but the Collective Knowledge package takes care of that. So you can install Bazel using one CK command, and then TensorFlow using another one. (Just copy and paste the instructions from the top of the issue, and give it about 8-9 hours on TX1.)

This will allow you to reproduce the issue in the least painful way. As you can see from other reports, it's not specific to using CK for TensorFlow installation.

body:
@gunan I believe one does need to patch Bazel on TX1 but the Collective Knowledge package takes care of that. So you can install Bazel using one CK command, and then TensorFlow using another one. (Just copy and paste the instructions from the top of the issue, and give it about 8-9 hours on TX1.)

This will allow you to reproduce the issue in the least painful way. As you can see from other reports, it's not specific to using CK for TensorFlow installation.
